update.description:
1. Load a model which has model plugins. For example:

    `gazebo worlds/initial_velocity.world`
    
1. Edit the model (right-click-> Edit Model). You'll see the model plugin name on the palette under Model Plugins (`large_wz`)

1. Double-click the plugin name to see its contents.

![modelPlugin.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/156906869-modelPlugin.png)


# Next steps

* Make it possible to delete a plugin

* Context menu when right-clicking plugin, with options to open inspector or delete it

* Make plugin inner xml editable - initially without format checking?

* Add an option to add plugins - initially from a hard-coded list?

* Once issue #1699 is addressed, improve plugin param editing and plugin listing
update.title: Display model plugins in the Model Editor

content.raw:
is it better to add an extra argument to specify the type of widget as opposed to checking the key? e.g.

~~~
CreateStringWidget(const std::string &_key, const int _level, const std::string &_type)
~~~

where `_type` could be `"plain" or "line"`
content.html:
is it better to add an extra argument to specify the type of widget as opposed to checking the key? e.g.

CreateStringWidget(const std::string &_key, const int _level, const std::string &_type)

where _type could be "plain" or "line"

content.raw:
[no gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/596/) ok

[gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/449/) the Jenkins machine ran out of memory...?

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/457/) seems ok

[coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/328/) these tests are not run on Jenkins...
content.html:
no gpu ok

gpu the Jenkins machine ran out of memory...?

homebrew seems ok

coverage these tests are not run on Jenkins...
